stance_1: I am concerned about animal welfare
stance_2: I have reduced red meat to once every other week
justification: The interviewee explicitly cites concern about animal welfare as a motivation for reducing red meat.

stance_1: I am concerned about animal welfare
stance_2: I have reduced white meat to twice a week
justification: Concern about animal welfare is explicitly stated as a motivation for reducing overall meat consumption, including white meat.

stance_1: I am concerned about animal welfare
stance_2: I hope to cut out red meat completely
justification: The desire to cut out red meat is explicitly linked to animal welfare concerns.

stance_1: I am concerned about my health
stance_2: I have reduced red meat to once every other week
justification: The interviewee explicitly states health concerns as a motivation for reducing red meat.

stance_1: I am concerned about my health
stance_2: I have reduced white meat to twice a week
justification: Health concerns are explicitly cited as a motivation for reducing white meat.

stance_1: I am concerned about my health
stance_2: I hope to cut out red meat completely
justification: The explicit goal to cut out red meat is supported by a concern for health.

stance_1: I am concerned about my health
stance_2: I have more energy after reducing meat
justification: The interviewee is concerned about health and explicitly reports improved energy—a health benefit—after reducing meat.

stance_1: I have reduced red meat to once every other week
stance_2: I hope to cut out red meat completely
justification: Current reduction of red meat is explicitly described as a step towards the goal of cutting it out entirely.

stance_1: I have reduced red meat to once every other week
stance_2: I have reduced white meat to twice a week
justification: Both reductions are described as part of the same effort to reduce meat consumption.

stance_1: I have reduced white meat to twice a week
stance_2: I hope to cut out red meat completely
justification: Reducing white meat is part of a broader effort that includes the goal of eliminating red meat.

stance_1: My friends and family do not believe meat is bad for health
stance_2: I am concerned about my health
justification: The interviewee’s health concerns are explicitly said to contrast with friends and family, who do not believe meat is bad for health.

stance_1: My friends and family do not reduce meat eating
stance_2: I have reduced red meat to once every other week
justification: The interviewee has reduced red meat, while friends and family have not changed their meat-eating habits, explicitly highlighting a contrast.

stance_1: My friends and family do not reduce meat eating
stance_2: I have reduced white meat to twice a week
justification: There is an explicit contrast between the interviewee’s reduction in white meat and friends/family not reducing meat.

stance_1: My friends and family do not reduce meat eating
stance_2: I hope to cut out red meat completely
justification: The interviewee's ambition to cut out red meat is explicitly contrasted with friends and family not reducing meat.
